==Educational institutions== A variety of higher educational institutions are located along the Golden Corridor, ranging from branch locations to community colleges to four year colleges. *[[Judson University]], a 4-year college located in [[Elgin, Illinois|Elgin]] *[[Harper College]], a very large community college located at Roselle Road and Algonquin Road in [[Palatine, Illinois|Palatine]] *[[Elgin Community College]], a community college in [[Elgin, Illinois|Elgin]] *[[Roosevelt University]] on McConnor Parkway in [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]] *[[Northern Illinois University|NIU Hoffman Estates]], the [[Hoffman Estates, Illinois|Hoffman Estates]] branch of Northern Illinois University, located at Beverly Road and I-90 *[[American InterContinental University]] has its online campus offices in [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]] *[[Argosy University]] branch in [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]] *[[DePaul University]] branch in [[Rolling Meadows]] *[[Olivet Nazarene University]] branch in [[Rolling Meadows]] *[[National Louis University]] branch in [[Elgin, Illinois|Elgin]] *[[Illinois Institute of Art – Schaumburg|Illinois Institute of Art]] in [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]] *[[Oakton Community College]] in [[Des Plaines, Illinois|Des Plaines]]
==Shopping centers== [[File:Schaumburg 2 S of Woodfield.jpg|thumb|right|300px|View of the area around [[Woodfield Mall]]]] Ranging from regional indoor malls to chic lifestyle centers, "the Golden Corridor" is a bustling center of retail activity. Major shopping centers include: *[[Woodfield Mall]], among the Top 10 largest malls in North America, and the largest in Illinois. Located at [[Illinois Route 58|Golf Road]] and [[Interstate 290 (Illinois)|Interstate 290]], just south of Interstate 90 *[[The Streets of Woodfield]], an outdoor mall of about 30 stores adjacent to Woodfield Mall. *[[Fashion Outlets of Chicago]], an enclosed 130-store outlet mall located at River Road and Balmoral Avenue, on the east side of [[Interstate 294]], just south of Interstate 90 and [[Interstate 190 (Illinois)|Interstate 190]], in [[Rosemont, Illinois|Rosemont]] *[http://www.primeoutlets.com/cntrdefault.asp?cntrid=1028 Huntley Prime Outlets], a 4-store outlet mall located at Route 47 and I-90 in [[Huntley, Illinois|Huntley]] *[[Algonquin Commons]] and the [[Algonquin Galleria]], the largest outdoor mall complex in Illinois. Located on [[Randall Road]], {{convert|5|mi|km}} north of I-90, in [[Algonquin, Illinois|Algonquin]] *[[Spring Hill Mall]], a regional mall at [[Illinois Route 31|Route 31]] and [[Illinois Route 72|Route 72]], {{convert|2|mi|km}} north of I-90, in [[West Dundee, Illinois|West Dundee]] *[[The Arboretum of South Barrington]] located in South Barrington, off of [[Illinois Route 59]] and [[Illinois Route 72]]. *One of two Chicago-area [[IKEA]] locations in [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]] *[[Cabela's]] in [[Hoffman Estates, Illinois|Hoffman Estates]]
==Entertainment and exhibition centers== From major arenas to convention centers to theaters to gambling centers, the Golden Corridor is a thriving entertainment center. Major facilities include: *[[Allstate Arena]], a 16,000 seat arena at Mannheim Road and Interstate 90 in [[Rosemont, Illinois|Rosemont]]. The arena is the home of the [[Chicago Wolves]] [[American Hockey League|AHL]] team, [[Chicago Sky]] [[Women's National Basketball Association|WNBA]] team, and [[DePaul Blue Demons]] college basketball team. *[[Sears Centre]], a 10,000 seat arena at Beverly Road and Interstate 90 in [[Hoffman Estates, Illinois|Hoffman Estates]]. The arena is the home of the [[Chicago Mustangs (MASL)|Chicago Mustangs]] [[Major Arena Soccer League|MASL]] team. *The [[Rosemont Theater]], a 4,000 seat theater in [[Rosemont, Illinois|Rosemont]]. *The Hemmens Cultural Center, a 1,200 seat theater in downtown [[Elgin, Illinois|Elgin]]. The theater is the home of the Elgin Symphony Orchestra. *The [[Donald E. Stephens Convention Center]], an {{convert|840000|sqft|m2|adj=on}} convention center in [[Rosemont, Illinois|Rosemont]]. *[[Schaumburg Hotel & Convention Center|Schaumburg Convention Center]] and Renaissance Hotel, a {{convert|175000|sqft|m2|adj=on}} convention center and 500-room hotel located at Meacham Road and I-90 in [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]]. *[[Medieval Times]], a dinner-theater located at Roselle Road and Interstate 90 in [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]]. *[[Legoland Discovery Center]] in [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]]. *[[Arlington Park]], a major [[horse racing]] track in [[Arlington Heights, Illinois|Arlington Heights]], along [[Illinois Route 53]], just {{convert|2|mi|km}} north of Interstate 90. *[[Grand Victoria Casino Elgin|Grand Victoria Riverboat]], located in downtown [[Elgin, Illinois|Elgin]], a couple miles south of Interstate 90. *[[Rivers Casino (Des Plaines)|Rivers Casino]], a casino located at River Road and Devon Avenue in [[Des Plaines, Illinois|Des Plaines]], on the east side of Interstate 294, just north of Interstate 90. It is Illinois' most-profitable casino. *The [[Schaumburg Baseball Stadium]], a 7,000+ seat minor league ballpark located on Springinsguth Road in [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]], a few miles south of Interstate 90. It is home of the [[Schaumburg Boomers]] professional minor league baseball team.
==Healthcare facilities== Located within five miles (8 km) of the Northwest Tollway are a variety of major hospitals, including: *[[Sherman Hospital]]: off [[Randall Road]], a half-mile south of Interstate 90 in [[Elgin, Illinois|Elgin]] *St. Joseph's Hospital: off [[Randall Road]], {{convert|3|mi|km}} south of Interstate 90 in [[Elgin, Illinois|Elgin]] *St. Alexius Hospital: on Barrington Road, a half-mile south of Interstate 90 in [[Hoffman Estates, Illinois|Hoffman Estates]] *Northwest Community Hospital: off Central Road, a mile north of Interstate 90 in [[Arlington Heights, Illinois|Arlington Heights]] *[http://amitahealth.org Alexian Brothers Hospital]: on Biesterfield Road, {{convert|3|mi|km}} south of Interstate 90 in [[Elk Grove Village, Illinois|Elk Grove Village]] *[[Advocate Lutheran General Hospital]]: a major hospital and trauma center on Dempster Street, {{convert|4|mi|km}} north of Interstate 90 in [[Park Ridge, Illinois|Park Ridge]]
==Hotels and restaurants== Nearly every national hotel and restaurant chain can be found along the corridor, as well as numerous independently owned and local chains.
The highest concentration of hotels can be found in the [[Schaumburg, Illinois|Schaumburg]]/[[Arlington Heights, Illinois|Arlington Heights]] and [[Rosemont, Illinois|Rosemont]]/[[O'Hare International Airport|O'Hare]] areas, with secondary concentrations in [[Hoffman Estates, Illinois|Hoffman Estates]], [[Elgin, Illinois|Elgin]], and [[Itasca, Illinois|Itasca]].
==Transportation infrastructure==
===Air transport=== *[[O'Hare International Airport|Chicago-O'Hare International Airport]], the busiest airport in the world (by total number of takeoffs and landings), is located within the Golden Corridor *[[Lake in the Hills Airport]], [[Schaumburg Regional Airport]], and [[Chicago Executive Airport]] (in nearby [[Wheeling, Illinois|Wheeling]]) provide general aviation service to the area
===Mass transit=== *[[Metra]]'s [[Union Pacific/Northwest Line]], [[North Central Service]], and [[Milwaukee District/West Line]] all offer commuter rail service to northwest suburban communities in the area. *[[Chicago Transit Authority|CTA]]'s [[Blue Line (Chicago Transit Authority)|Blue Line]] is a rapid transit train line which terminates at [[O'Hare (CTA)|O'Hare]] and has stops at [[Rosemont (CTA)|Rosemont]] and [[Cumberland (CTA)|Cumberland]], with additional stops further east, providing access to downtown Chicago and the entire CTA system. *[[Pace (transit)|Pace]] and CTA both offer scheduled fixed-route bus service to the area, with numerous routes. Pace's headquarters are located within the scope of the corridor, in Arlington Heights.
===Limited access highways=== *[[Interstate 90]] ("[[Jane Addams Memorial Tollway]]") is the primary interstate highway in the area, providing high-speed limited-access transportation for the corridor. In addition to providing direct highway access to many of the local roads, communities, and amenities of the Golden Corridor, it also provides access to [[Rockford, Illinois|Rockford]] to the west and downtown Chicago to the east, and extends coast-to-coast, from [[Seattle, Washington|Seattle]] to [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]]. *[[Interstate 190 (Illinois)|Interstate 190]] provides direct access from Interstates 90 and 294 to Chicago-O'Hare International Airport. *[[Interstate 290 (Illinois)|Interstate 290]]/[[Illinois Route 53]] is a limited access highway that intersects Interstate 90 in Schaumburg near Woodfield Mall. It provides access to the northwest suburbs to the north and to the western suburbs to the south and east, as well as access to downtown Chicago. *[[Interstate 294]] ("[[Tri-State Tollway]]") is a limited access north-south highway that intersects Interstate 90 near Rosemont. It provides access to the northern suburbs to the north, as well as the western and southern suburbs to the south. *[[Illinois Route 390]] ("Elgin-O'Hare Tollway") is a limited access highway that runs from [[U.S. Route 20]] in Hanover Park to Thorndale Road in Itasca, providing local access for communities in that area. An eastward extension of the expressway to the west side of Chicago-O'Hare International Airport at York Road is currently under construction, as is a northward leg to Interstate 90 and a southward leg to Interstate 294.
===Highways and roads=== Local east-west highways that serve the region include [[Stearns Road (Chicago)|Stearns Road]], [[U.S. Route 20]] (Lake Street), [[Illinois Route 19]] (Irving Park Road), Thorndale Avenue, Biesterfield Road, Devon Avenue, [[Illinois Route 72]] (Higgins Road and Touhy Avenue), Schaumburg Road, [[Illinois Route 58]] (Golf Road), [[Illinois Route 62]] (Algonquin Road), Kirchoff Road, Dempster Street, Oakton Street, Euclid Avenue, Central Avenue, [[U.S. Route 14]] (Northwest Highway/Ronald Reagan Highway), [[U.S. Route 12]] (Rand Road), Palatine Road, [[Illinois Route 68]] (Dundee Road), Huntley Road, and Big Timber Road.
Local north-south highways that serve the region include [[Illinois Route 47]], [[Randall Road]], [[Illinois Route 31]], [[Illinois Route 25]] (Dundee Avenue), Beverly Road, [[Illinois Route 59]] (Sutton Road), Bartlett Road, Barrington Road, Springinsguth Road, Ela Road, Roselle Road, Plum Grove Road, Quentin Road, Meacham Road, Arlington Heights Road, [[Illinois Route 83]] (Elmhurst Road and Busse Road), York Road, Mount Prospect Road, Wolf Road, [[U.S. Route 45]] (River Road and Lee Street/Mannheim Road), and [[Illinois Route 171]] (Cumberland Avenue).
==See also== *[[Illinois Technology and Research Corridor]], located along [[Interstate 88 (west)|Interstate 88]] - a counterpart to the Golden Corridor *[[Lakeshore Corridor]], located along [[Interstate 94 in Illinois|Interstate 94]] - a counterpart to the Golden Corridor *[[List of edge cities]] *[[List of technology centers]]

revision.text:
'''GuideWorks, LLC''' is the joint venture of '''[[Comcast]]''' and '''[[Gemstar-TV Guide International]]''' that was formed in April 2004 for the purpose of creating navigation software (also known as Interactive Program Guides) for digital cable television. Comcast owns a majority stake in the venture.
The software developed by GuideWorks is widely deployed in Comcast digital cable systems throughout the USA, and delivers both [[Video On Demand]] and [[Digital Video Recorder]] features to consumers. Gemstar TV Guide markets the GuideWorks software to other cable companies.
Prior to the formation of the joint venture, Gemstar-TV Guide International, Inc developed and marketed the navigation software to Comcast and other cable operators. During this period, the name [[i-Guide]] became associated with the products, which gained a reputation for strong promotion of advertising similar to the ads that appear on web pages today. This advertising aspect underwent significant deemphasis after the formation of the GuideWorks joint venture in 2004.
In 2010, Rovi, the corporate descendent of Gemstar-TV Guide, pulled out of the venture. GuideWorks is now wholly owned by Comcast.<ref>{{cite press release|publisher=Rovi|date=March 1, 2010|url=http://www.rovicorp.com/company/newscenter/pressreleases/1434_13248.htm |title=Rovi Announces Expanded Data and Patent License Agreement with Comcast|accessdate=2012-03-14}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.guideworkstv.com/ Official website] * [http://www.comcast.com Comcast] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070623220634/http://www.gemstartvguide.com/ Gemstar-TV Guide International, Inc.]
{{Comcast}}
[[Category:Joint ventures]]

{{Infobox person |name =Guma Aguiar | image = Guma Aguiar.jpg | caption = |birth_name = Guma Leandro Aguiar |birth_date ={{Birth date|1977|5|31}} |birth_place = Rio de Janeiro, Brazil | disappeared_date = {{disappeared date and age|2012|6|19|1977|5|31}} | disappeared_place =[[Port Everglades]], Broward County, Florida, United States | disappeared_status = |death_date = [[Declared death in absentia|Declared legally dead]] January 29, 2015 |death_place = |residence = |nationality = | other_names = Guma Kaplan Aguiar{{cite web|last=Kamph |first=Stefan |url=http://blogs.browardpalmbeach.com/pulp/2012/09/guma_aguiar_israel_jerusalem_real_estate.php |title=Guma Aguiar's Apt.: Magic Mirror, Dolce & Gabbana Bathtub and More |publisher=Blogs.browardpalmbeach.com |date=2012-09-21 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/fla-judge-tosses-out-embezzlement-case-against-nbn-donor-1.278875 |title=Fla. judge tosses out embezzlement case against NbN donor |publisher=Haaretz.com |accessdate=2013-12-02}} |ethnicity = |alma_mater = |occupation = |spouse = {{marriage|Jamie Black|2005}} |children = 4 |parents = Otto de Souza Aguiar
Ellen Kaplan |known for = June 2012 disappearance | networth = }} '''Guma Leandro Aguiar''' (May 31, 1977 – disappeared June 19, 2012; [[Declared death in absentia|declared legally dead]] January 29, 2015{{Cite web|url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/local/broward/fort-lauderdale/fl-guma-declared-dead-hearing-20150129-story.html|title=Broward judge declares missing millionaire dead|last=Sun-Sentinel|first=South Florida|website=Sun-Sentinel.com|access-date=2016-05-24}}) was a Brazilian-born American energy [[industrialist]] and millionaire businessman who split his time between the United States and Israel. Aguiar was recognized as a philanthropist who supported a variety of Jewish causes including [[Nefesh B'Nefesh]] and the [[March of the Living]].ASHER ZEIGER and JTA, [http://www.timesofisrael.com/body-feared-to-be-that-of-guma-aguiar-found-on-florida-coast/ Body feared to be that of Guma Aguiar found on Florida coast], June 22, 2012, Retrieved December 4, 2013 In July 2009, Aguiar invested over $4 million (USD) in support of the [[Beitar Jerusalem F.C.|Beitar Jerusalem Football Club]]. On June 20, 2012, Aguiar was reported missing after his unoccupied boat was found on Fort Lauderdale Beach.{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/millionaire-guma-aguiars-ghost-vessel-comes-ashore-on-fort-lauderdale-beach |title=Millionaire Guma Aguiar's ghost vessel comes ashore on Fort Lauderdale beach |publisher=Wptv.com |date=2012-06-20 |accessdate=2012-07-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120623194328/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/millionaire-guma-aguiars-ghost-vessel-comes-ashore-on-fort-lauderdale-beach |archivedate=2012-06-23 |df= }} The day before Aguiar went missing, a federal court judge ordered his mental health records be presented to the court as part of a lawsuit between him and his uncle [[Thomas Kaplan]].{{cite web|last=Kamph |first=Stefan |url=http://blogs.browardpalmbeach.com/pulp/2012/06/guma_aguiars_mental_health_rec.php |title=Guma Aguiar's Mental Health Records Were Requested in Federal Court a Day Before He Vanished |publisher=Blogs.browardpalmbeach.com |date=2012-06-28 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was declared legally dead in January 2015. ==Early life and education== Aguiar was born on May 31, 1977http://www.flpd.org/Home/ShowDocument?id=2568 in Rio de Janeiro. He was one of four children{{Cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2014-05-16/news/fl-guma-aguiar-estate-trial-openings-20140516_1_ellen-aguiar-guma-aguiar-jamie-aguiar|title=Missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire's mother, wife face off in Broward courtroom|access-date=2016-06-24}} of Ellen{{Cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/187806#.V22XnqKhNow|title='Vanished' Millionaire Guma Aguiar's Estate Divided among Heirs|website=Arutz Sheva|access-date=2016-06-24}} ({{née}} Kaplan), a Jewish mother,[http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-30/news/fl-guma-aguiar-troubled-life-20120630_1_ellen-aguiar-rocky-seas-guma-aguiar Florida Sun Sentinel: "Turmoil and depression haunted missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire Aguiar" By Linda Trischitta and Robert Nolin] June 30, 2012 and Otto de Souza Aguiar, a Christian father. His mother is the sister of billionaire investor [[Thomas Kaplan]], and his father was an artist and model.{{Cite web|url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/news/the-mystery-of-missing-fort-lauderdale-millionaire-guma-aguiar-6389180|title=The Mystery of Missing Fort Lauderdale Millionaire Guma Aguiar|last=Kamph|first=Stefan|date=2012-09-20|access-date=2016-06-24}} Though Ellen is [[Halakha|halachically]] Jewish, she considers herself a [[Born again (Christianity)|born-again]] Christian; Guma was raised as a Christian and the rest of the Aguiar family practiced Christianity as well. At age 26, Aguiar returned to Jewish observance after meeting rabbi [[Tovia Singer]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thejc.com/lifestyle/lifestyle-features/20957/israels-abramovich-uses-football-unite-jerusalem|title=Israel's Abramovich uses football to unite Jerusalem | The Jewish Chronicle|date=2009-10-15|publisher=Thejc.com|accessdate=2012-07-09}} However, because he was born to an [[Halakha|halachically]] Jewish mother, he did not need to formally convert. His family moved to [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]] when Aguiar was one year old. He graduated from the [[Westminster Academy (Florida)|Westminster Academy Christian School]] in 1995.{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-video-interview-captures-missing-multimillionaire-in-happier-moments |title=Guma Aguiar video: Interview captures missing multimillionaire in happier moments |publisher=Wptv.com |date=2012-04-23 |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20131030095704/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-video-interview-captures-missing-multimillionaire-in-happier-moments |archivedate=2013-10-30 |df= }} Aguiar enrolled at [[Clemson University]] in [[Clemson, South Carolina]] but dropped out after one year. ==Career== Aguiar was the vice chairman and [[chief executive officer]] of [[Leor Energy]]. Aguiar began his career as a clerk on the floor of the [[New York Mercantile Exchange|NYMEX]] in 1999 where he focused on the energy markets, with particular emphasis on [[natural gas]]. Transitioning from daily trading activity to the long-term physical markets, Aguiar joined with his uncle, [[Thomas Kaplan]], in 2001 to manage a portfolio of family investments ranging from [[venture capital]] to [[private equity]] and debt. During this time, he served as a director of several public and private companies and was given responsibility for creating a U.S.-based energy company focused on aggressive early-stage oil and gas exploration. After assembling a diversified portfolio of energy properties in Louisiana and Texas, ranging from unconventional natural gas to shallow oil, Aguiar identified and executed Leor's acquisition of its flagship property in the [[Deep Bossier]] of [[East Texas]] in 2003. In 2005, under Aguiar's executive management, Leor Energy engineered financings which fully capitalized the projects in Leor Energy LP. Included in these transactions were Leor Energy Lp industrial alliance with Encana, a natural gas producer in North America and the Leor Energy Lp joint-venture partner in the Deep Bossier. Under Aguiar, a [[Mezzanine capital|mezzanine financing]] with hedge-fund Amaranth Capital LLC{{Citation needed|date=October 2013}} was achieved.{{cite web|author= |url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=4288364&privcapId=27143526&previousCapId=27143526&previousTitle=Leor%20Energy%20L.P |title=Guma Aguiar: Executive Profile & Biography - Businessweek |publisher=Investing.businessweek.com |date=2003-06-30 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Leor Energy has a financial alliance with its first strategic equity partner, [[Goldman Sachs|Goldman Sachs & Co]]. Aguiar joined Cadence Resources in July 2002 and served as a Member of the Board of Directors of Corporate Development until June 30, 2003. ==Philanthropic activities== Aguiar was the director of the Lillian Jean Kaplan Foundation and was involved in numerous philanthropic activities.{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2009-01-25/news/0901240172_1_messiah-guma-aguiar-nephew|title=Multimillion-dollar family feud in court|work=tribunedigital-sunsentinel|accessdate=14 June 2015}} He donated more than US$8 million to fund the activities of [[Nefesh B'Nefesh]], a [[Zionist]] organization which promotes [[Aliyah]] (Jewish immigration) from North America and the United Kingdom to Israel. He was a supporter of the [[March of the Living]], which organizes educational programming in Poland and Israel to enable students to better understand the [[Holocaust]] and the rebirth of [[Zionism]] and the creation of the modern Jewish state of Israel. For his philanthropic activities, in April 2009, [[The Jewish Week]] recognized Aguiar as one of the "36 under 36″ (one of 36 of the most influential Jewish leaders under the age of 36).{{cite web|url=http://www.thejewishweek.com/special_sections/36_under_36/36_under_36_2009_guma_aguiar_33|title=36 Under 36 2009: Guma Aguiar, 33 - The Jewish Week|work=The Jewish Week|accessdate=14 June 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303172755/http://www.thejewishweek.com/special_sections/36_under_36/36_under_36_2009_guma_aguiar_33|archivedate=3 March 2016|df=}} In 2008, Aguiar founded the "Defender of Jerusalem Award" which recognizes public figures who have taken uniquely strong stances in support of Jerusalem.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcdfw.com/news/local/Perry-in-Israel-to-Receive--53135252.html|title=Perry in Israel to Receive Defender of Jerusalem Award|work=NBC 5 Dallas-Fort Worth|accessdate=14 June 2015}} In October 2009, Aguiar and his wife Jamie served as the co-chairs of the "Facing Tomorrow" Conference in Jerusalem organized by Israel's President [[Shimon Peres]]. During the conference, Aguiar was featured on a panel with the President and offered his vision of Israeli society and culture from the perspective of one of the country's most recognized entrepreneurs. ==Jerusalem sports== On July 21, 2009, Aguiar announced an investment of over US$4 million to support the [[Beitar Jerusalem]] [[Football team|Football Team]] which, despite a massive fan following, had grown into [[financial distress]] and was on the brink of collapse prior to Aguiar's financial contributions. Aguiar was motivated to purchase the team out of his love for the sport combined with a passion for Jerusalem and Israel. In September 2009, Aguiar took his commitment to Jerusalem sports to the next level when he invested over $1.5 million in the city's leading basketball franchise, [[Hapoel Jerusalem B.C.|Hapoel Jerusalem]]. Since these investments, Aguiar became a fixture in Israeli social circles and regularly met with members of Knesset and local political and business leaders. Aguiar managed the teams and was in contact with the general managers of both Betar ([[Itzik Kornfein]]) and Hapoel (Dani Klein). In November 2009, Aguiar travelled with Kornfein to Brazil with the goal of scouting out players for the Betar team. He made an effort to be at team practices and met with the players and staff of both teams. Beitar fans attribute Beitar's winning the [[Toto Cup]] on 26 January 2010 to Aguiar's financial backing, although it was won while Aguiar was hospitalized in a psychiatric facility. About a half an hour after winning, Itzik Kornfein{{cite web |url=http://www.sport5.co.il/articles.aspx?FolderID=282&docID=72728&lang=HE |title=קורנפיין נסע עם גביע הטוטו לאגיאר |publisher=Sport5.co.il |date=2010-01-26 |accessdate=2012-09-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130108072905/http://www.sport5.co.il/articles.aspx?FolderID=282&docID=72728&lang=HE |archivedate=2013-01-08 |df= }} took the Toto Cup to the psychiatric hospital but was not permitted to enter. He asked the security staff to take in the trophy to the hospitalized Aguiar. ==Personal life== In 2005, Aguiar married his [[Westminster Academy (Florida)|Westminster Academy]] high school sweetheart, Jamie Elizabeth Black. Jamie graduated from the [[University of Florida]] with a degree in Public Relations.{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-30/news/fl-guma-aguiar-troubled-life-20120630_1_ellen-aguiar-rocky-seas-guma-aguiar |title=Guma Aguiar: Missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire's life was in turmoil - Sun Sentinel |publisher=Articles.sun-sentinel.com |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} They had four children, Jacob, Lilly, Jonathan, and Leo{{cite web|url=http://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/new-york/nysdce/1:2011mc00290/383539/3/3.html|title=Document 3 :: Ellen Aguiar v. William Natbony, et al :: 1:2011mc00290 :: New York Southern District Court :: US Federal District Courts Cases :: Justia|date=|publisher=Law.justia.com|accessdate=2013-12-02}} and celebrated both Christmas and Hanukkah.[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2253254/Wife-missing-millionaire-Guma-Aguiar-speaks-grief-holiday-season.html The Daily Mail: "Wife of millionaire who mysteriously vanished on night-time boat ride tells of her heartache as she spends first Christmas alone with their children"] December 25, 2012 The process of immigration to Israel was an act described by himself as a personal dream.{{citation needed|date=May 2013}} Prior to his disappearance, Aguiar divided his time between the [[Yemin Moshe]] quarter in [[Jerusalem]] and South Florida. Aguiar was friends with [[Alan Dershowitz]].{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2012/08/27/new-clues-in-the-mysterious-disappearance-of-multimillionaire-guma-aguiar.html |title=New Clues in the Mysterious Disappearance of Multimillionaire Guma Aguiar |publisher=Thedailybeast.com |date=2012-08-27 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was a [[Zionism|Zionist]]. ==Criminal history== Aguiar pleaded no contest to drug charges in 2009 after police found marijuana in his car during a traffic stop in Florida.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57460337/ |title=Missing oil tycoon Guma Aguiar was spiraling out of control before vanishing at sea, friends say |publisher=CBS News |date=2012-06-26 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-30/news/fl-guma-aguiar-troubled-life-20120630_1_ellen-aguiar-rocky-seas-guma-aguiar/2 |title=Guma Aguiar: Missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire's life was in turmoil - Page 2 - Sun Sentinel |publisher=Articles.sun-sentinel.com |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|author=Stefan Kamph |url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/2012-09-20/news/fort-lauderdale-millionaire-guma-aguiar-s-disappearance-at-sea-is-a-mystery/5/ |title=The Mystery of Missing Fort Lauderdale Millionaire Guma Aguiar - Page 5 - News - Miami |publisher=Miami New Times |date=2012-09-20 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vosizneias.com/39972/2009/10/18/fort-lauderdale-fl-multimillionaire-who-accused-broward-deputies-of-anti-semitism-takes-plea-deal/ |title=Fort Lauderdale, FL - Multimillionaire Who Accused Broward Deputies of Anti-Semitism Takes Plea Deal |publisher=VosIzNeias.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar publicly stated that the police were out to get him and that "When I got to the prison [an officer] took my kippah off and then tried to convert me to Christianity."{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/alan-dershowitz-enlisted-by-guma-aguiar-to-take-on-fla-law-1.5540 |title=Alan Dershowitz enlisted by Guma Aguiar to take on Fla. law |publisher=Haaretz.com |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar hired [[Alan Dershowitz]] to represent him.{{cite web |url=http://israelity.com/2010/01/14/israeli-billionaire-in-psychiatric-hospital/ |title=Israeli billionaire in psychiatric hospital |publisher=Israelity |date=2010-01-14 |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102075629/http://israelity.com/2010/01/14/israeli-billionaire-in-psychiatric-hospital/ |archivedate=2013-11-02 |df= }} Aguiar's wife Jamie filed a domestic violence protective order against him in the summer of 2011. He then filed for divorce, but both the domestic violence allegations and the divorce filing were stopped. ==Mental health== Aguiar's mother has said that Aguiar experienced his first [[Psychosis|psychotic]] episode at age 19 and that he was diagnosed with severe [[Bipolar I disorder|bipolar]] disorder and psychosis.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/missing-millionaire-guma-aguiars-billionaire-uncle-thomas-kaplan/story?id=16703264 |title=Missing Millionaire Guma Aguiar's Billionaire Uncle Thomas Kaplan Is Suspicious - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=2012-07-03 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was admitted to psychiatric hospitals several times.{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/national/guma-aguiar-missing-turmoil-and-depression-haunted-missing-fort-lauderdale-millionaire |title=Guma Aguiar missing: Turmoil and depression haunted missing Fort Lauderdale millionaire |publisher=Wptv.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20131030095720/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/national/guma-aguiar-missing-turmoil-and-depression-haunted-missing-fort-lauderdale-millionaire |archivedate=2013-10-30 |df= }} On January 14, 2010, Aguiar was [[Involuntary commitment|involuntarily committed]] to a mental hospital in Israel by his mother.{{cite web|author= |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/rabbis-facilitate-truce-missing-millionaire-guma-aguiars-mom/story?id=16671744&page=2 |title=Page 2: Rabbis Facilitate Truce Between Missing Millionaire Guma Aguiar's Mom and Wife - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=2012-06-28 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|last=Tracy |first=Marc |url=http://www.tabletmag.com/news-and-politics/23723/prodigal-son/ |title=Prodigal Son - by Allison Hoffman - Tablet Magazine – Jewish News and Politics, Jewish Arts and Culture, Jewish Life and Religion |publisher=Tabletmag.com |date=2010-01-15 |accessdate=2012-07-09}}{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/nathanvardi/2012/06/28/the-tragedy-of-guma-aguiar-and-a-2-billion-texas-gas-fortune/ |title=The Tragedy Of Guma Aguiar And A $2 Billion Texas Gas Fortune |publisher=Forbes |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel/Betar-sponsor-in-psychiatric-hospital |title=Betar sponsor in psychiatric hospital | JPost | Israel News |publisher=JPost |date=2010-01-17 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vosizneias.com/46976/2010/01/14/jerusalem-court-orders-guma-aguiar-to-psychiatric-hospital/ |title=Jerusalem - Court Orders Guma Aguiar To Psychiatric Hospital |publisher=VosIzNeias.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-02}} In 2011, due to his mental illness, his wife Jamie and mother Ellen petitioned a [[Miami-Dade County, Florida|Miami-Dade]] judge for guardianship over Aguiar. The court agreed, and appointed an emergency guardianship over Aguiar.{{cite web|author= |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/troubled-florida-millionaire-guma-aguiar-missing-empty-yacht/story?id=16619645&page=2 |title=Page 2: Troubled Florida Millionaire Guma Aguiar Missing After Empty Yacht Washes Ashore - ABC News |publisher=Abcnews.go.com |date=2012-06-21 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Two days after his disappearance in June 2012, Aguiar's mother filed documents in Broward County, Florida court to become [[Conservatorship|conservator]] of his nearly $100 million fortune. In Ellen Aguiar's petition, she wrote that Guma "disappeared as the result of mental derangement or other mental cause" or disappeared "under circumstances indicating that he may have died, either naturally, or accidentally." It further stated that he suffered from "severe bipolar disorder."{{cite web|author= |url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-22/news/fl-guma-aguiar-missing-folo-20120621_1_fishing-boat-search-ends-petition |title=Missing millionaire Guma Aguiar - Sun Sentinel |publisher=Articles.sun-sentinel.com |date=2012-06-22 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} Aguiar was sued by his uncle [[Thomas Kaplan]]. As part of that lawsuit, the judge presiding over the case, John O'Sullivan, found that Aguiar's psychosis "manifested itself in both grandiose and paranoid delusions," for example, Aguiar's belief that he (Aguiar) was being followed by snipers. On the day Aguiar disappeared, a federal judge in Florida issued an order appointing an independent medical examiner to see if Aguiar was psychologically sound enough for a deposition in the case. ==Disappearance== On June 20, 2012, Aguiar's 31-foot, center console Jupiter boat, named the ''T.T. Zion'',{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2012-06-20/news/fl-missing-fort-lauderdale-boater-20120620_1_detective-travis-mandell-fishing-boat-captain |title=Millionaire missing after boat washes ashore on Fort Lauderdale beach | first = Linda | last = Trischitta | first2 = Jon | last2 = Burstein | work = Sun Sentinel |date=2012-06-20 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite web |last=Trischitta |first=Linda |url=http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-missing-as-the-search-ends-for-missing-millionaire-mother-seeks-to-protect-his-assets |title=Guma Aguiar missing: As the search ends for missing millionaire, mother seeks to protect his assets |publisher=WPTV.com |date=2012-06-22 |accessdate=2013-12-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120624235845/http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/guma-aguiar-missing-as-the-search-ends-for-missing-millionaire-mother-seeks-to-protect-his-assets |archivedate=2012-06-24 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2012/06/21/Yacht-tender-washes-ashore-without-owner/UPI-20981340307068/ |title=Yacht tender washes ashore without owner Guma Aguiar |publisher=UPI.com |date=2012-06-21 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} landed on Fort Lauderdale Beach east of East Las Olas Boulevard around 1:15 a.m., with its navigation lights on and engines still running, according to the ''[[Sun-Sentinel]]''. [[Sea Tow]], the company that Fort Lauderdale authorities contracted to tow the boat, said that the vessel appeared seaworthy and did not believe a mechanical problem had occurred. Aguiar's wallet and cell phone were found on board, but no sign of him or any other passenger was found. Authorities on [[All-terrain vehicle|ATVs]] searched up and down the beach, but found no sign of Aguiar. The [[United States Coast Guard|Coast Guard]] commenced a search at sea. A search of his house found that his watch and wedding band had been left behind.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2197830/Guma-Aguiar-Missing-millionaire-left-wedding-ring-watch-night-disappeared.html |title=Guma Aguiar: Missing millionaire left his wedding ring and watch behind on night he disappeared... but he bought [sic] along a special Jewish text for 'solace' | first = Beth | last = Stebner | first2 = Meghan | last2 = Keneally |publisher=DailyMail.co.uk |date=2012-09-03 |accessdate=2013-12-02}} In July 2012 and June 2013, the Ft. Lauderdale Police Department said that even though the investigation remains open, there have been no significant leads in the case.{{cite web|url=http://www.shmais.com/chabad-news/latest/item/new-clues-in-the-mysterious-disappearance-of-multimillionaire-guma-aguiar |title=New Clues in the Mysterious Disappearance of Multimillionaire Guma Aguiar |publisher=Shmais.com |date=2012-08-27 |accessdate=2013-12-02}}{{cite news | url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/06/19/guma-aguiar-update-2013_n_3463073.html | title = Guma Aguiar: Fate of Missing Fort Lauderdale Millionaire Still A Mystery One Year Later | work = Sun Sentinel | first = Linda | last = Trischitta | date = August 18, 2013 | location = Fort Lauderdale, Florida}} Aguiar was declared legally dead on January 29, 2015, two years and seven months after his disappearance.{{Cite news |url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/local/broward/fort-lauderdale/fl-guma-declared-dead-hearing-20150129-story.html|title=Broward judge declares missing millionaire dead| first = Linda | last = Trischitta | work=Sun-Sentinel| date = January 29, 2015 | access-date=2016-05-24}} ==See also== {{portal|Biography|Brazil|Florida|Israel}} *[[List of people who disappeared mysteriously]] {{clear}} the oil industry]] [[Category:American philanthropists]] [[Category:American people of Brazilian-Jewish descent]] [[Category:American Zionists]] [[Category:Baalei teshuva]] [[Category:Beitar Jerusalem F.C.]] [[Category:Bermuda Triangle]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Florida]] [[Category:Brazilian former Christians]] [[Category:Brazilian Jews]] [[Category:Brazilian emigrants to Israel]] [[Category:Brazilian emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:Israeli businesspeople]] [[Category:Israeli football chairmen and investors]] [[Category:Israeli Jews]] [[Category:Missing person cases in Florida]] [[Category:People with bipolar disorder]] [[Category:Jewish American sportspeople]] [[Category:Jewish philanthropists]] [[Category:2010s missing person cases]] [[Category:People declared dead in absentia]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} [[File:Fritz Haber.png|thumb|[[Fritz Haber]], 1918]] The '''Haber process''', also called the '''Haber–Bosch process''', is an artificial [[nitrogen fixation]] process and is the main industrial procedure for the [[ammonia production|production of ammonia]] today.{{cite book |last=Appl |first=M. |chapter=The Haber–Bosch Process and the Development of Chemical Engineering |title=A Century of Chemical Engineering |location=New York |publisher=Plenum Press |year=1982 |pages=29–54 |isbn=978-0-306-40895-3 }}{{Ullmann|first=Max|last=Appl|title=Ammonia|doi=10.1002/14356007.a02_143.pub2|year=2006}} It is named after its inventors, the German chemists [[Fritz Haber]] and [[Carl Bosch]], who developed it in the first decade of the 20th century. The process converts atmospheric [[nitrogen]] (N2) to [[ammonia]] (NH3) by a reaction with [[hydrogen]] (H2) using a metal catalyst under high temperatures and pressures: :\underbrace{\ce{N2 + 3H2}}_{\Delta H^\circ = -91.8\,\mathrm{kJ}} \ce{->} \underbrace{\ce{2NH3}}_{{\Delta H^\circ = -45.8\,\mathrm{kJ\cdot mol^{-1}}}} Before the development of the Haber process, ammonia had been difficult to produce on an industrial scale,{{cite book|last1=Smil|first1=Vaclav|title=Enriching the Earth: Fritz Haber, Carl Bosch, and the Transformation of World Food Production|date=2004|publisher=MIT|location=Cambridge, MA|isbn=9780262693134|edition=1st}}{{cite book|last1=Hager|first1=Thomas|title=The Alchemy of Air: A Jewish genius, a doomed tycoon, and the scientific discovery that fed the world but fueled the rise of Hitler|date=2008|publisher=Harmony Books|location=New York, NY|isbn=978-0-307-35178-4|edition=1st}}{{cite book|last1=Sittig|first1=Marshall|title=Fertilizer Industry: Processes, Pollution Control, and Energy Conservation|date=1979|publisher=Noyes Data Corp.|location=Park Ridge, NJ|isbn=978-0-8155-0734-5}} with early methods such as the [[Birkeland–Eyde process]] and [[Frank–Caro process]] all being highly inefficient. Although the Haber process is mainly used to produce [[fertilizer]] today, during [[World War I]] it provided [[German Empire|Germany]] with a source of ammonia for the production of [[explosive]]s, compensating for the [[Allies of World War I|Allied Powers]]' trade blockade on [[Nitratine|Chilean saltpeter]]. ==History== {{Main|History of the Haber process}} Throughout the 19th century the demand for nitrates and ammonia for use as fertilizers and industrial feedstocks had been steadily increasing. The main source was mining [[niter]] deposits. At the beginning of the 20th century it was being predicted that these reserves could not satisfy future demands {{cite book|last1=James|first1=Laylin K.|title=Nobel Laureates in Chemistry 1901–1992|date=1993|publisher=American Chemical Society|location=Washington, DC|isbn=978-0-8412-2690-6|page=118|edition=3rd}} and research into new potential sources of ammonia became more important. The obvious source was atmospheric nitrogen (N2), comprising nearly 80% of the air, however N2 is exceptionally stable and will not readily react with other chemicals. Converting N2 into ammonia posed a challenge for chemists globally. Haber, with his assistant [[Robert Le Rossignol]], developed the high-pressure devices and [[catalysts]] needed to demonstrate the Haber process at laboratory scale.{{cite book|last1=Haber|first1=Fritz|title=Thermodynamik technischer Gasreaktionen|date=1905|publisher=Salzwasser Verlag|location=Paderborn|isbn=9783864448423|edition=1st|language=German}}{{Citation |title=Robert Le Rossignol, 1884–1976: Professional Chemist |year=2009 |journal=ChemUCL Newsletter |url=http://www.ucl.ac.uk/chemistry/alumni/documents/A5booklet_020909.pdf |page=8 |doi= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110113022251/http://www.ucl.ac.uk/chemistry/alumni/documents/A5booklet_020909.pdf |archivedate=13 January 2011 |df= }} They demonstrated their process in the summer of 1909 by producing ammonia from air, drop by drop, at the rate of about {{convert|125|ml|USoz|sigfig=1|abbr=on}} per hour. The process was purchased by the German chemical company [[BASF]], which assigned [[Carl Bosch]] the task of scaling up Haber's tabletop machine to industrial-level production.Bosch, Carl (2 March 1908) "Process of producing ammonia". {{US Patent|990191}} He succeeded in 1910. Haber and Bosch were later awarded [[Nobel Prize|Nobel prizes]], in 1918 and 1931 respectively, for their work in overcoming the chemical and engineering problems of large-scale, continuous-flow, high-pressure technology. Ammonia was first manufactured using the Haber process on an industrial scale in 1913 in BASF's [[Ludwigshafen#Oppau|Oppau]] plant in Germany, reaching 20 tonnes per day the following year.Philip, Phylis Morrison (2001) [https://web.archive.org/web/20120702093415/http://www.americanscientist.org/bookshelf/pub/from-fertile-minds "From Fertile Minds" (review)]. ''American Scientist''. During [[World War I]], the production of [[munitions]] required large amounts of nitrate. The Allies had access to large [[sodium nitrate]] deposits in [[Chile]] (Chile saltpetre) controlled by British companies. Germany had no such resources, so the Haber process proved essential to the German war effort.{{cite news|title=Nobel Award to Haber|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1920/02/03/118255924.pdf|accessdate=11 October 2010|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=3 February 1920}} Synthetic ammonia from the Haber process was used for the production of [[nitric acid]], a precursor to the nitrates used in explosives. == Process == [[File:Ammoniak Reaktor BASF.jpg|thumb|upright|A historical (1921) high-pressure steel reactor for production of ammonia via the Haber process is displayed at the [[Karlsruhe Institute of Technology]], Germany.]] [[File:Ammoniakreaktor MS.svg|thumb|upright|scheme of ammoniac reactor]] This conversion is typically conducted at {{convert|15|–|25|MPa|abbr=on|lk=on|atm psi}} and between {{convert|400|–|500|°C|°F|abbr=on}}, as the gases (nitrogen and hydrogen) are passed over four beds of [[catalyst]], with cooling between each pass so as to maintain a reasonable [[equilibrium constant]]. On each pass only about 15% conversion occurs, but any unreacted gases are recycled, and eventually an overall conversion of 97% is achieved. The steam reforming, shift conversion, carbon dioxide removal, and methanation steps each operate at pressures of about {{convert|2.5|–|3.5|MPa|abbr=on|bar psi}}, and the ammonia synthesis loop operates at pressures ranging from {{convert|6|–|18|MPa|abbr=on|bar psi}}, depending upon which proprietary process is used. ===Sources of hydrogen=== The major source of hydrogen is [[methane]] from [[natural gas]]. The conversion, [[steam reforming]], is conducted with steam in a high temperature and pressure tube inside a reformer with a nickel catalyst, separating the carbon and hydrogen atoms in the natural gas. ===Reaction rate and equilibrium=== Nitrogen (N2) is very unreactive because the [[molecules]] are held together by strong [[Chemical bond|triple bonds]]. The Haber process relies on catalysts that accelerate the scission of this triple bond. Two opposing considerations are relevant to this synthesis: the position of the equilibrium and the [[reaction rate|rate of reaction]]. At room temperature, the equilibrium is strongly in favor of ammonia, but the reaction doesn't proceed at a detectable rate. The obvious solution is to raise the temperature, but because the reaction is [[exothermic reaction|exothermic]], the equilibrium constant (using bar or [[atmosphere (unit)|atm]] units) becomes 1 around {{convert|150|–|200|°C|F|abbr=on}}. (See [[Le Châtelier's principle]].) {| style="clear:right; float:right; margin-left: 1em;" border="3" class="wikitable" |+''K''p(''T'') for {{chem|N|2}} + 3 {{chem|H|2}} ⇌ 2 {{chem|N|H|3}}{{cite book|last=Brown|first=Theodore L.|last2=LeMay|first2=H. Eugene, Jr|last3=Bursten|first3= Bruce E |title=Chemistry: The Central Science|edition=10th |location=Upper Saddle River, NJ|publisher= Pearson|date= 2006|chapter= Table 15.2| isbn=978-0-13-109686-8}} |- ! Temperature (°C) ! ''K''p |- |align="center" | 300 | 4.34 × 10−3 |- |align="center" | 400 | 1.64 × 10−4 |- |align="center" | 450 | 4.51 × 10−5 |- |align="center" | 500 | 1.45 × 10−5 |- |align="center" | 550 | 5.38 × 10−6 |- |align="center" | 600 | 2.25 × 10−6 |} Above this temperature, the equilibrium quickly becomes quite unfavorable at atmospheric pressure, according to the [[Van 't Hoff equation]]. Thus one might suppose that a low temperature is to be used and some other means to increase rate. However, the catalyst itself requires a temperature of at least 400 °C to be efficient. [[Pressure]] is the obvious choice to favor the forward reaction because there are 4 moles of reactant for every 2 moles of product (see [[entropy]]), and the pressure used ({{convert|15|–|25|MPa|abbr=on|bar psi}}) alters the equilibrium concentrations to give a profitable yield.{{citation needed|date=August 2012}} Economically, pressure is an expensive commodity. Pipes, valves, and reaction vessels need to be strengthened, and there are safety considerations of working at 20 MPa. In addition, running pumps and compressors takes considerable energy. Thus the compromise used gives a single pass yield of around 15%.{{citation needed|date=August 2012}} Another way to increase the yield of the reaction would be to remove the product (i.e. ammonia gas) from the system. In practice, gaseous ammonia is not removed from the reactor itself, since the temperature is too high; it is removed from the equilibrium mixture of gases leaving the reaction vessel. The hot gases are cooled enough, whilst maintaining a high pressure, for the ammonia to condense and be removed as liquid. Unreacted hydrogen and nitrogen gases are then returned to the reaction vessel to undergo further reaction.{{citation needed|date=August 2012}} ===Catalysts=== The most popular catalysts are based on iron promoted with K2O, CaO, SiO2, and Al2O3. The original Haber–Bosch reaction chambers used [[osmium]] as the catalyst, but it was available in extremely small quantities. Haber noted [[uranium]] was almost as effective and easier to obtain than osmium. Under Bosch's direction in 1909, the BASF researcher [[Alwin Mittasch]] discovered a much less expensive [[iron]]-based catalyst, which is still used today. Some ammonia production utilizes [[ruthenium]]-based catalysts (the KAAP process). Ruthenium forms more active catalysts that allows milder operating pressures. Such catalysts are prepared by decomposition of [[triruthenium dodecacarbonyl]] on [[graphite]]. In industrial practice, the iron catalyst is obtained from finely ground iron powder, which is usually obtained by reduction of high purity [[magnetite]] (Fe3O4). The pulverized iron metal is burnt (oxidized) to give magnetite of a defined particle size. The magnetite particles are then partially reduced, removing some of the [[oxygen]] in the process. The resulting catalyst particles consist of a core of magnetite, encased in a shell of [[wüstite]] (FeO, ferrous oxide), which in turn is surrounded by an outer shell of iron metal. The catalyst maintains most of its bulk volume during the reduction, resulting in a highly porous high surface area material, which enhances its effectiveness as a catalyst. Other minor components of the catalyst include [[Calcium oxide|calcium]] and [[aluminium oxide]]s, which support the iron catalyst and help it maintain its surface area. These oxides of Ca, Al, K, and Si are unreactive to reduction by the hydrogen. [[File:Potential energy diagram for ammonia synthesis.svg|thumb|upright=1.5|energy diagram]] The [[reaction mechanism]], involving the heterogeneous catalyst, is believed to involve the following steps:{{cite web |last1=Wennerström |first1=Håkan |last2=Lidin |first2=Sven |title=Scientific Background on the Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2007 Chemical Processes on Solid Surfaces |url=https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/2007/advanced-chemistryprize2007.pdf |website=NobelPrize.org |publisher=Swedish Academy of Sciences |accessdate=17 September 2015}} # N2 (g) → N2 (adsorbed) # N2 (adsorbed) → 2 N (adsorbed) # H2 (g) → H2 (adsorbed) # H2 (adsorbed) → 2 H (adsorbed) # N (adsorbed) + 3 H(adsorbed)→ NH3 (adsorbed) # NH3 (adsorbed) → NH3 (g) Reaction 5 occurs in three steps, forming NH, NH2, and then NH3. Experimental evidence points to reaction 2 as being the slow, [[rate-determining step]]. This is not unexpected since the bond broken, the nitrogen triple bond, is the strongest of the bonds that must be broken. A major contributor to the elucidation of this mechanism is [[Gerhard Ertl]].{{cite journal |title=Interaction of nitrogen with iron surfaces: I. Fe(100) and Fe(111) |journal=[[Journal of Catalysis|J. Catal.]] |volume=49 |issue=1 |year=1977 |pages=18–41 |first1=F. |last1=Bozso |first2=G. |last2=Ertl |first3=M. |last3=Grunze |first4=M. |last4=Weiss |doi=10.1016/0021-9517(77)90237-8}}. {{cite journal |title=The structure of atomic nitrogen adsorbed on Fe(100) |journal=[[Surface Science|Surf. Sci.]] |volume=123 |issue=1 |year=1982 |pages=129–140 |first1=R. |last1=Imbihl |first2=R. J. |last2=Behm |first3=G. |last3=Ertl |first4=W. |last4=Moritz |doi=10.1016/0039-6028(82)90135-2 |bibcode=1982SurSc.123..129I|url=https://epub.ub.uni-muenchen.de/5778/1/Moritz_Wolfgang_5778.pdf }}. {{cite journal |title=Kinetics of nitrogen adsorption on Fe(111) |journal=[[Surface Science|Surf. Sci.]] |volume=114 |issue=2–3 |year=1982 |pages=515–526 |first1=G. |last1=Ertl |first2=S. B. |last2=Lee |first3=M. |last3=Weiss |doi=10.1016/0039-6028(82)90702-6 |bibcode=1982SurSc.114..515E}}. {{cite journal |title=Primary steps in catalytic synthesis of ammonia | first=G. |last=Ertl |journal=[[Journal of Vacuum Science and Technology A|J. Vac. Sci. Tech. A]] |year=1983 |volume=1 |issue=2 |pages=1247–1253 |doi=10.1116/1.572299}} ==Economic and environmental aspects== {{further|Ammonia production#Sustainable ammonia production}} [[File:Severnside fertilizer works - geograph.org.uk - 189990.jpg|thumbnail|right|Industrial fertilizer plant]] When it was first invented, the Haber process needed to compete against another industrial process, the [[Frank–Caro process|Cyanamide process]]. However, the Cyanamide process consumed large amounts of electrical power and was more labor-intensive than the Haber process.{{rp|137–143}} The Haber process now produces 450 million tonnes of nitrogen [[fertilizers|fertilizer]] per year, mostly in the form of anhydrous [[ammonia]], [[ammonium nitrate]], and [[urea]]. Three to five percent of the world's natural gas production is consumed in the Haber process (around 1–2% of the world's energy supply).{{cite web |url=http://www.eia.doe.gov/oiaf/ieo/nat_gas.html |title=International Energy Outlook 2007|publisher=U.S. Energy Information Administration}}Fertilizer statistics. {{cite web|url=http://www.fertilizer.org/ifa/statistics/indicators/ind_reserves.asp|title=Raw material reserves|publisher=International Fertilizer Industry Association|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080424083111/http://www.fertilizer.org/ifa/statistics/indicators/ind_reserves.asp|archivedate=24 April 2008|df=}}{{cite journal | doi = 10.1126/science.1076659 |date=September 2002 |last= Smith |first= Barry E. |title = Structure. Nitrogenase reveals its inner secrets |volume=297 |issue=5587 |pages=1654–5 |pmid=12215632 |journal=[[Science (journal)|Science]]}} In combination with pesticides, these fertilizers have quadrupled the productivity of agricultural land: {{quote|With average crop yields remaining at the 1900 level the crop harvest in the year 2000 would have required nearly four times more land and the cultivated area would have claimed nearly half of all ice-free continents, rather than under 15% of the total land area that is required today.{{cite journal |last1=Smil |first1=Vaclav |year=2011 |title=Nitrogen cycle and world food production |url=http://www.vaclavsmil.com/wp-content/uploads/docs/smil-article-worldagriculture.pdf |format=PDF |journal=World Agriculture |volume=2 |issue= |pages=9–13}}}} Due to its dramatic impact on the human ability to grow food, the Haber process served as the "detonator of the population explosion", enabling the global population to increase from 1.6 billion in 1900 to today's 7 billion.{{cite journal |last1=Smil |first1=Vaclav |year=1999 |title=Detonator of the population explosion |url=http://www.vaclavsmil.com/wp-content/uploads/docs/smil-article-1999-nature7.pdf |format=PDF |journal=Nature |volume=400 |issue= 6743|page=415 |doi=10.1038/22672|bibcode=1999Natur.400..415S }} Nearly 50% of the nitrogen found in human tissues originated from the Haber-Bosch process.{{Cite journal|last=Erisman|first=Jan Willem|last2=Sutton|first2=Mark A.|last3=Galloway|first3=James|last4=Klimont|first4=Zbigniew|last5=Winiwarter|first5=Wilfried|date=28 September 2008|title=How a century of ammonia synthesis changed the world|journal=Nature Geoscience|volume=1|issue=10|pages=636–639|doi=10.1038/ngeo325|bibcode=2008NatGe...1..636E}} Since nitrogen use efficiency is typically less than 50%,{{cite journal |last1=Oenema |first1=O. |last2=Witzke |first2= H.P. |last3=Klimont |first3=Z. |last4=Lesschen |first4=J.P. |last5=Velthof |first5=G.L. |year=2009 |title=Integrated assessment of promising measures to decrease nitrogen losses in agriculture in EU-27 |url = |journal=Agriculture, Ecosystems and Environment |volume=133 |issue= 3–4|pages=280–288 |doi=10.1016/j.agee.2009.04.025}} farm runoff from heavy use of fixed industrial nitrogen disrupts biological habitats.{{cite journal|last1=Howarth|first1=R. W.|year=2008|title=Coastal nitrogen pollution: a review of sources and trends globally and regionally|url=|journal=Harmful Algae|volume=8|issue=|pages=14–20|doi=10.1016/j.hal.2008.08.015}} ==See also== *[[Guano]] *[[Hydrogen production]] *[[Industrial gas]] *[[Texas City disaster]] *[[West Fertilizer Company explosion]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://www.idsia.ch/~juergen/haberbosch.html Haber-Bosch process], most important invention of the 20th century, according to V. Smil, [[Nature (journal)|Nature]], 29 July 1999, p 415 (by [[Jürgen Schmidhuber]]) *[http://www.britannica.com/nobelprize/article-9038696 Britannica guide to Nobel Prizes: Fritz Haber] *[http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/1918/haber-bio.html Nobel e-Museum – Biography of Fritz Haber] *[https://archive.is/20140210085650/http://www.basf.com/group/corporate/en/news-and-media-relations/science-around-us/ammonia/story BASF – Fertilizer out of thin air] *[http://www.ausetute.com.au/haberpro.html Uses and Production of Ammonia] *[http://www.ias.ac.in/resonance/Volumes/16/12/1159-1167.pdf Haber Process for Ammonia Synthesis] *[http://www.fas.harvard.edu/~hsdept/bios/docs/shapin_LRBHaber.pdf Review of "Between Genius and Genocide: The Tragedy of Fritz Haber, Father of Chemical Warfare" by Daniel Charles ] *{{cite web | title = The Haber Process | url = http://www.chemguide.co.uk/physical/equilibria/haber.html | work = Chemguide.co.uk}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:BASF]] [[Category:Chemical processes]] [[Category:Industrial processes]] [[Category:Equilibrium chemistry]] [[Category:Peak oil]] [[Category:Catalysis]] [[Category:History of mining in Chile]] [[Category:German inventions]] [[Category:Industrial gases]] [[Category:Name reactions]] [[Category:Fritz Haber]] [[Category:1909 in science]] [[Category:1909 in Germany]]

revision.text:
{{Other people|John Delaney|John Delaney (disambiguation){{!}}John Delaney}} {{Infobox person | name = John Delaney | image = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = 16 October 1967 | birth_place = [[Waterford]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] | death_place = | nationality = [[Irish people|Irish]] | spouse. = Emma English | occupation = | years_active = | known_for = [[Chief executive officer|Dictator]] of the [[Football Association of Ireland]] (FAI) | home_town = [[Tipperary (town)|Tipperary]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] | religion = | children = | parents = | website = | imagesize = }}
'''John Delaney''' (born 16 October 1967) became [[Chief executive officer|chief executive]] of the [[Football Association of Ireland]] (FAI) in March 2005, having held the post in an acting role for several months. He completed all his exams to become a chartered accountant but up to September 2016 had not gone through the formality of joining Chartered Accountants Ireland (CAI).<ref>{{cite news | last = Fallon | first = John | title = FAI boss scores own goal on qualifications | newspaper = The Sunday Times | date = 4 September 2016 | url = https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/fai-boss-scores-own-goal-on-qualifications-szr6k0w8v | access-date = 22 April 2018}}</ref> He is also chairman of the board of directors of the Aviva Stadium.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.avivastadium.ie/stadium-info/about-us | title = About Us | website = avivastadium.ie | access-date = 22 April 2018 }}</ref> He was elected to the executive committee of UEFA at the Helsinki Congress on the 5th April 2017.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.uefa.com/insideuefa/about-uefa/executive-committee/news/newsid=2455275.html | title = John Delaney | date = 5 April 2017 | website = UEFA.com | publisher = UEFA | access-date = 22 April 2018}}</ref>
John Delaney became a member of the Executive Committee of the Olympic Council of Ireland (OCI) in 2005.<ref>{{cite web|title=THE OLYMPIC COUNCIL OF IRELAND|url=https://benefacts.ie/org/1c9ab936-0179-4e55-9413-8d35ad81b7d7/the-olympic-council-of-ireland-limited|website=benefacts.ie|publisher=benefacts.ie|accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref><ref name="Moran">{{Citation | last = Moran | first = Carroll | title = REPORT of the Moran Inquiry (Inquiry into the receipt, distribution and sale of tickets to Olympic Games and ancillary matters) | publisher = Department of Transport, Tourism and Sport | year = 2017 | chapter = Chapter One: Introduction | page = 9 | url = http://www.dttas.ie/sites/default/files/publications/corporate/english/moran-inquiry-report/moran-inquiry-reportpublished.pdf}}</ref> He was re-elected unopposed as Second Vice-President of the OCI in 2008.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sonia in line for Olympic Council role|url=http://www.irishexaminer.com/sport/other-sports/sonia-in-line-for-olympic-council-role-74441.html|accessdate=22 August 2016|publisher=Irish Examiner|date=10 October 2008}}</ref> He resigned from the Executive Committee and from his position as the Second Vice-President of the OCI on 25 October 2016.<ref name="Moran" /><ref>{{cite news | last = McConnell | first = Daniel | last2 = O Cionnaith | first2 = Fiachra | title = FAI boss John Delaney resigns as vice president of OCI | newspaper = Irish Examiner | date = 26 October 2016 | url = https://www.irishexaminer.com/ireland/fai-boss-john-delaney-resigns-as-vice-president-of-oci-427527.html | access-date = 22 April 2018}}</ref> Prior to this, he had been seen as heir apparent to OCI president Pat Hickey.<ref>{{cite news | last = D'Arcy | first = Ciarán | title = Who’s who on the Olympic Council of Ireland executive committee: Members include FAI chief executive John Delaney, seen as heir apparent to Pat Hickey | newspaper = The Irish Times | date = 21 August 2016 | url = https://www.irishtimes.com/sport/who-s-who-on-the-olympic-council-of-ireland-executive-committee-1.2763777 | access-date = 22 April 2018}}</ref>
==Soccer administration career==
He rose to prominence in the wake of the [[2002 Roy Keane incident|2002 Keane Saipan saga]], having emerged as the FAI's public figurehead during the affair.<ref name="pens"/> He became acting chief executive of the organisation in December 2004, after [[Fran Rooney]]'s acrimonious departure.<ref name="King John">{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/uneasy-lies-the-head-that-wears-the-crown-but-king-john-will-not-abdicate-1203023.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130217205925/http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/uneasy-lies-the-head-that-wears-the-crown-but-king-john-will-not-abdicate-1203023.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=17 February 2013 |title=Uneasy lies the head that wears the crown, but King John will not abdicate |work=Irish Independent |date=24 October 2007 |accessdate=27 August 2010 |df= }}</ref><ref name="coup">{{cite news|url=http://www.rte.ie/sport/soccer/irish/2004/1103/187107-rooney/|title=FAI confirms Rooney departure|work=RTÉ Sport|date=3 November 2004|accessdate=27 August 2010}}</ref> Delaney became Acting Chief Executive of the FAI in December 2004, and took up the role full-time in March 2005.<ref name="rte">{{cite news|url=http://www.rte.ie/sport/2006/1112/ireland.html|title=FAI extend Delaney's tenure|work=RTÉ Sport|date=12 November 2006|accessdate=15 February 2007}}</ref> In November 2006, his contract was extended to 2012.<ref name="rte"/> In July 2010, the FAI's [[Board of Directors]] agreed to extend his contract once again, until 2015.<ref name="pens">{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/delaney-pens-new-deal-to-stay-at-fai-helm-2253406.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120912180836/http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/delaney-pens-new-deal-to-stay-at-fai-helm-2253406.html |archive-date=12 September 2012 |title=Delaney pens new deal to stay at FAI helm |work=Irish Independent |date=10 July 2010 |accessdate=13 July 2010 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Delaney has overseen the appointments of [[Steve Staunton]], [[Giovanni Trapattoni]], and [[Martin O'Neill]] to manage the [[Republic of Ireland national football team]].
==Handball incident==
When FIFA offered Ireland a Fair Play Award following 2009's [[2009 Republic of Ireland v France football matches|France v Republic of Ireland play-off]], Delaney respectfully declined and said FIFA President [[Sepp Blatter]] was "an embarrassment to himself and an embarrassment to FIFA".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/312423-ireland-turns-down-fifas-patronizing-fair-play-award-for-2009|first=Willie|last=Gannon|title=Ireland Turns Down FIFA's Patronizing Fair Play Award|date=21 December 2009|accessdate=21 December 2009|work=Bleacher Report}}</ref>
On 4 June 2015, it was revealed by Delaney that [[FIFA]] had paid the FAI €5m (£3.6m) to stop legal action against them after their controversial [[2009 Republic of Ireland v France football matches|World Cup play-off defeat]] in 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-33011692|title= Fifa paid Irish to stop legal action over Thierry Henry handball|date=4 June 2015|work=BBC Sport |accessdate=5 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/international-soccer/delaney-claims-5m-fifa-payoff-was-a-good-deal-31279675.html|title= Delaney claims €5m Fifa payoff ‘was a good deal’|date=4 June 2015|work=Irish Independent |accessdate=5 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/international-soccer/eamon-dunphy-the-fifa-payment-to-the-fai-was-like-something-from-the-sopranos-31279282.html|title= Eamon Dunphy: The FIFA payment to the FAI was like something from The Sopranos|date=4 June 2015|work=Irish Independent |accessdate=5 June 2015}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
